page.title: 03Kegworth Schools History.
page.content: {Kegworths}first{school,}the{Queen {Elizabeth School,}was built in the late 15 hundreds on{Nottingham Road and run by the church. It is now a cottage called Harrison house,named after the Harrison family. The old {school}house on{Dragwell}is 142 years old and the children used slate and chalk to write on.In 1939 the children in the old{school}moved to the present {school}on{High Street,}this was built on the site of an old farm. In 1955 the playing field was added and in 1968 an infant block was built making a total of 10 classes. The present headmaster,{Mr Westhead,}came to the {school}in 1960.In 1975 an outdoor pool was built. The{school roll}of some 200 children aged from 4 to 10 has fallen over the last 9 years but at the moment seems to be rising again due to new house building.
